title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Le Sagitaire [Sagitterius], from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled boarder in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite on supportt, above image:  Le Sagitaire [Sagittarius]; below image:  quand tu seras plus grand/tu atteindras plus haut [when you are bigger/you will reach higher]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  10
dimensions:
6.2 x 5.7 cm (2 7/16 x 2 1/4 in. ), image
6.2 x 15 cm (7 3/4 x 6 in.), support
description: Scene in a walled garden.  A man, seated left foreground, is teaching a young child holding a bow, how to shoot.  Two arrows appear in the wall, right middleground, above semi-circular cave in wall.  Two women, right background, watch the archery lesson.  The man, tells the boy that he will shoot higher when he grows taller.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Le Sagitaire [Sagitterius], from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824.Pen and brown ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled boarder in pen and brown ink. 1989-13-46.
